text: powerful passage of Scripture that really reveals to us not only the faith and obedience of Abraham, but it's one of the the mountain peaks of Scripture, if you will. As we look at the passage of Scripture and as we are mindful of the, you know, historical account that takes place and obviously have the ability to learn very important life lessons, we also are mindful of the fact that this passage of Scripture provides us with a beautiful type of the Lord Jesus Christ in his substitutionary atonement on the cross of Calvary for the sin of mankind. But I wonder how far up the mountain of Genesis 22 I have been willing to go. At what point in my life, and I'd ask you to ask yourself the same questions, that I've said this is kind of as far as I'm going to go, this is as much as I'm willing to surrender, this is as far as I'm willing to make sacrifice, or are we just really all in? I'm yours. I'm going to present my body a living sacrifice. Can we truly say, here am I, Lord, send me? And if God says, I want you to go to, you just fill in a country. I believe that the testimony of Abraham is easily summarized by two phrases, faith and obedience, surrender and sacrifice. Oh, how much do we believe God? He believed that God could do something that had never been done, that God could raise up His Son. He's saying, are you willing to surrender this? What is it that you're unwilling to give up for me?
